verses.verse: He <WG1161> also <WG2532> said <WG3004> to <WG4314> his <WG846> disciples, <WG3101> "There was <WG2258> a certain <WG5100> rich <WG4145> man <WG444> who <WG3739> had <WG2192> a manager. <WG3623> An <WG2532> accusation <WG1225> was made to him <WG846> that <WG5613> this man <WG3778> was wasting <WG1287> his <WG846> possessions. <WG5224>

He <WG2532> called <WG5455> him, <WG846> and <WG2532> said <WG2036> to him, <WG846> <WG5124> 'What is this that I hear <WG191> about <WG4012> you? <WG4675> Give <WG591> an accounting <WG3056> of your <WG4675> management, <WG3622> for <WG1063> you can no <WG3756> longer <WG2089> be <WG1410> manager. <WG3621>'

"The <WG1161> manager <WG3623> said <WG2036> within <WG1722> himself, <WG1438> <WG5101> 'What will I do, <WG4160> seeing <WG3754> that my <WG3450> lord <WG2962> is taking away <WG851> the management <WG3622> position from <WG575> me? <WG1700> I <WG2480> don't <WG3756> have strength to dig. <WG4626> I am ashamed <WG153> to beg. <WG1871>

I know <WG1097> what <WG5101> I will do, <WG4160> so that <WG2443> when <WG3752> I am removed <WG3179> from management, <WG3622> they may receive <WG1209> me <WG3165> into <WG1519> their <WG846> houses. <WG3624>'

<WG2532> Calling <WG4341> each <WG1538> one <WG1520> of his <WG1438> lord <WG2962>'s debtors <WG5533> to him, <WG3004> he said to the first, <WG4413> <WG4214> 'How much do you <WG3784> owe to my <WG3450> lord? <WG2962>'

He <WG1161> said, <WG2036> <WG1540> 'A hundred batos <WG943> of oil. <WG1637>' He <WG2532> said <WG2036> to him, <WG846> <WG1209> 'Take your <WG4675> bill, <WG1121> and <WG2532> sit down <WG2523> quickly <WG5030> and write <WG1125> fifty. <WG4004>'

Then <WG1899> he <WG2036> said to another, <WG2087> <WG1161> 'How much <WG4214> do you <WG4771> owe? <WG3784>' He <WG1161> said, <WG2036> <WG1540> 'A hundred cors <WG2884> of wheat. <WG4621>' He <WG2532> said <WG3004> to him, <WG846> <WG1209> 'Take your <WG4675> bill, <WG1121> and <WG2532> write <WG1125> eighty. <WG3589>'

"His <WG2532> lord <WG2962> commended <WG1867> the dishonest <WG93> manager <WG3623> because <WG3754> he had done <WG4160> wisely, <WG5430> for <WG3754> the children <WG5207> of this <WG5127> world <WG165> are, <WG1526> in <WG1519> their <WG1438> own generation, <WG1074> wiser <WG5429> than <WG5228> the children <WG5207> of the light. <WG5457>

I <WG2504> tell <WG3004> you, <WG5213> make <WG4160> for yourselves <WG1438> friends <WG5384> by <WG1537> means of unrighteous mammon, <WG3126> so that <WG2443> when <WG3752> you <WG5209> fail, <WG1587> they may receive <WG1209> you <WG5209> into <WG1519> the eternal <WG166> tents. <WG3126>

He who <WG3588> is faithful <WG4103> in <WG1722> a very little <WG1646> is faithful <WG4103> also <WG2532> in <WG1722> much. <WG4183> He <WG2532> who <WG3588> is <WG2076> dishonest <WG94> in <WG1722> a very little <WG1646> is <WG2076> also <WG2532> dishonest <WG94> in <WG1722> much. <WG4183>

If <WG1487> therefore <WG3767> you have <WG1096> not <WG3756> been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in <WG1722> the unrighteous <WG94> mammon, <WG3126> who <WG5101> will commit <WG4100> to your <WG5213> trust <WG4100> the true riches? <WG228>

<WG2532> If <WG1487> you have <WG1096> not <WG3756> been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in <WG1722> that which <WG3588> is another <WG245>'s, who <WG5101> will give <WG1325> you <WG5213> that which <WG3588> is your own? <WG5212>

No <WG3762> servant <WG3610> can <WG1410> serve <WG1398> two <WG1417> masters, <WG2962> for <WG1063> either <WG2228> he will hate <WG3404> the one, <WG1520> and <WG2532> love <WG25> the other; <WG2087> or else <WG2228> he will hold to <WG472> one, <WG1520> and <WG2532> despise <WG2706> the other. <WG2087> You aren't <WG1410> <WG3756> able to serve <WG1398> God <WG2316> and <WG2532> mammon. <WG3126>"
The <WG1161> Pharisees, <WG5330> who were <WG5225> lovers of money, <WG5366> also <WG2532> heard <WG191> all <WG3956> these things, <WG5023> and <WG2532> they scoffed <WG1592> at him. <WG846>

He <WG2532> said <WG2036> to them, <WG846> "You <WG5210> are <WG2075> those who <WG3588> justify <WG1344> yourselves <WG1438> in the sight <WG1799> of men, <WG444> but <WG1161> God <WG2316> knows <WG1097> your <WG5216> hearts. <WG2588> For <WG3754> that which <WG3588> is exalted <WG5308> among <WG1722> men <WG444> is <WG2076> an abomination <WG946> in the sight <WG1799> of God. <WG2316>

The law <WG3551> and <WG2532> the prophets <WG4396> were until <WG2193> John. <WG2491> From <WG575> that time <WG5119> the Good News of the Kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is preached, <WG2097> and <WG2532> everyone <WG3956> is forcing <WG971> his way into <WG1519> it. <WG846>

But <WG1161> it is <WG2076> easier <WG2123> for heaven <WG3772> and <WG2532> earth <WG1093> to pass <WG3928> away, <WG2228> than for one <WG1520> tiny stroke <WG2762> of a pen in the law <WG3551> to fall. <WG4098>

Everyone <WG3956> who divorces <WG630> his <WG846> wife, <WG1135> and <WG2532> marries <WG1060> another, <WG2087> commits adultery. <WG3431> He <WG2532> who <WG3956> marries one <WG1060> who <WG3588> is divorced <WG630> from <WG575> a husband <WG435> commits adultery. <WG3431>

"Now there was <WG2258> a certain <WG5100> rich <WG4145> man, <WG444> and <WG2532> he was clothed <WG1737> in purple <WG4209> and <WG2532> fine linen, <WG1040> living <WG2165> in luxury <WG2988> every <WG2596> day. <WG2250>
A <WG1161> <WG2258> certain <WG5100> beggar, <WG4434> named <WG3686> Lazarus, <WG2976> was <WG3739> laid <WG906> at <WG4314> his <WG846> gate, <WG4440> full of sores, <WG1669>

and <WG2532> desiring <WG1937> to be fed <WG5526> with <WG575> the crumbs <WG5589> that <WG3588> fell <WG4098> from <WG575> the rich man <WG4145>'s table. <WG5132> Yes, <WG235> even <WG2532> the dogs <WG2965> came <WG2064> and licked <WG621> his <WG846> sores. <WG1668>

It <WG1161> happened <WG1096> that the beggar <WG4434> died, <WG599> and <WG1161> that he <WG846> was carried <WG667> away by <WG5259> the angels <WG32> to <WG1519> Abraham <WG11>'s bosom. <WG1161> The rich man <WG4145> also <WG2532> died, <WG599> and <WG2532> was buried. <WG2290>

<WG2532> In <WG1722> Hades, <WG86> he lifted up <WG1869> his <WG846> eyes, <WG3788> being <WG5225> in <WG1722> torment, <WG931> and saw <WG3708> Abraham <WG11> far <WG3113> off, <WG575> and <WG2532> Lazarus <WG2976> at <WG1722> his <WG846> bosom. <WG2859>

<WG2532> He <WG846> cried <WG5455> and said, <WG2036> <WG3962> 'Father Abraham, <WG11> have mercy <WG1653> on me, <WG3165> and <WG2532> send <WG3992> Lazarus, <WG2976> that <WG2443> he may dip <WG911> the tip <WG206> of his <WG846> finger <WG1147> in water, <WG5204> and <WG2532> cool <WG2711> my <WG3450> tongue! <WG1100> For <WG3754> I am in anguish <WG3600> in <WG1722> this <WG3778> flame. <WG5395>'

"But <WG1161> Abraham <WG11> said, <WG2036> <WG5043> 'Son, remember <WG3415> that <WG3754> you, <WG4771> in <WG1722> your <WG4675> lifetime, <WG2222> received <WG618> your <WG4675> good things, <WG18> and <WG2532> Lazarus, <WG2976> in the same <WG3668> way, <WG2556> bad things. But <WG1161> now <WG3568> here he <WG3592> is comforted <WG3870> and <WG1161> you <WG4771> are in anguish. <WG3600>

<WG2532> Besides <WG1909> all <WG3956> this, <WG5125> between <WG3342> us <WG2257> and <WG2532> you <WG5216> there is a great <WG3173> gulf <WG5490> fixed, <WG4741> that <WG3704> those who <WG3588> want to <WG4314> pass <WG1224> from here <WG1782> to <WG4314> you <WG5209> are not <WG3361> able, <WG3366> and that <WG3588> none may cross over <WG1276> from there <WG1564> to <WG4314> us. <WG2248>'

"He <WG1161> said, <WG2036> <WG2065> 'I ask you <WG4571> therefore, <WG3767> father, <WG3962> that <WG2443> you would send <WG3992> him <WG846> to <WG1519> my <WG3450> father <WG3962>'s house; <WG3624>

for <WG1063> I have <WG2192> five <WG4002> brothers, <WG80> that <WG3704> he may testify <WG1263> to them, <WG846> so <WG2443> they <WG846> won't <WG3361> also <WG2532> come <WG2064> into <WG1519> this <WG5126> place <WG5117> of torment. <WG931>'
"But Abraham <WG11> said <WG3004> to him, <WG846> <WG2192> 'They have Moses <WG3475> and <WG2532> the prophets. <WG4396> Let them listen <WG191> to them. <WG846>'

"He <WG1161> said, <WG2036> <WG3780> 'No, father <WG3962> Abraham, <WG11> but <WG235> if <WG1437> one <WG5100> goes <WG4198> to <WG4314> them <WG846> from <WG575> the dead, <WG3498> they will repent. <WG3340>'

"He <WG1161> said <WG2036> to him, <WG846> <WG1487> 'If they don't <WG3756> listen <WG191> to Moses <WG3475> and <WG2532> the prophets, <WG4396> neither <WG3761> will they be persuaded <WG3982> if <WG1437> one <WG5100> rises <WG450> from <WG1537> the dead. <WG3498>'"
